subtitle: This recipe uses fresh yeast but 10g of dried yeast may be used instead.

method.text: Slice half the tomatoes and chop the remainder. Heat half the oil in a pan and fry the garlic for 30 sec. Add the chopped tomatoes. Cover and simmer for 10 min, until reduced to a dry pulp. Season and cool.

Make the pizza base. Cream the fresh yeast with 2 tablespoons of warm water. Sift the flour and salt into a bowl. Make a well in the centre of the flour and pour in the yeast mix, oil and half the milk. Mix to a firm dough adding more milk if necessary. Knead for 5 min.
Cover and leave the dough to rise in a warm place until doubled in size.

Knead the dough for 2 min. Cut in half, roll each piece into a 20-23 cm circle. Place the pizza bases on oiled trays. Brush with oil. Cover with the tomato pulp. Arrange the fresh tomato slices over each pizza. Sprinkle over the Mozzarella and oregano.
Drizzle the remaining oil over the pizzas and bake for 20-25 min.
If adding the anchovies, drain them and use a sharp knife to slit each fillet in half lengthways. Arrange the anchovy fillets on the pizzas before the Mozzarella.

title: Tomato pizza
